elements.title: 1st Armoured Division (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1st Armoured Division of the British Army chose a white rhinoceros on a black oval as their insignia (pictured)?

elements.title: Bertha McNeill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bertha McNeill challenged policies of the Women's International League for Peace and Freedom that excluded Black women from full membership in the organization?

elements.title: Regine at the Theater (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the concert series Regine at the Theater was conceived two years earlier but was delayed after singer Regine Velasquez suffered acid reflux?

elements.title: Hodges Figgis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hodges Figgis, a bookseller in Dublin, celebrated its 250th year with the largest ever anthology of new Irish writing, with 250 contributors?

elements.title: Henri Hekking (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that two American officers bribed Japanese troops with their watches to have Dutch medical officer Henri Hekking allocated to their prisoner of war camp?

elements.title: 1978 Tabriz protests (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at least 14 people were killed during the 1978 Tabriz protests in Iran, which were meant to commemorate the dead in the 1978 Qom protest?

elements.title: Unitized Group Ration – Express (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Unitized Group Ration – Express is designed to heat food itself without the need of a field kitchen?

elements.title: Edgar Underwood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that on his death, medical historian Edgar Underwood was described by The Times as one of the last of a dying race, the "canny Scot"?
